title: E. Guigal 2015 White (Côtes du Rhône)
description: Pristine green apple, lemon and lime are gilded with honeycomb in this medium-to-full-bodied white. Expansive and weighty on the palate, it finises long on a twist of bitter lime pith. Drink now through 2020.

title: Estrin 2014 Merlot (Wahluke Slope)
description: Fruit for this wine all comes from Riverbend Vineyard and saw just 10% new French oak. Blended with 17% Cabernet Sauvignon, a medley of fresh herbs pop on the aromas, which also show notes of cigar box and whiffs of pencil lead. The palate brings cranberry-tart fruit flavors that offer pleasing depth and stretch out on the finish. It provides a lot of quality and value.

title: Fattoria di Lamole 2011 Le Stinche Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: This 100% Sangiovese opens with earthy aromas of tilled soil, baked plum and leather. The dense, solid palate delivers ripe black cherry, licorice and a touch of star anise alongside smooth, seasoned tannins. Enjoy through 2023.

title: Florent Descombe 2016 Cuvée A  (Saint-Amour)
description: One of a series of Beaujolais cru wines from this négociant, this bottling comes from the northernmost village. It is firm and structured, layering rich tannins and plenty of spicy blackberry fruits. Drink from late 2018.

title: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Jean-Ernest Descombes  (Morgon)
description: One of two wines named after a legendary vine grower in Morgon, this wine has weight and great tannins. Structured, ripe black fruits are generous and developing well. The boisterous fruit needs to calm down a little, so drink this wine from late 2018.

title: Hermann Moser 2016 Ried Gebling Reserve Der Löss Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)
description: This wine's almost glowingly ripe fruit notes stream from the glass: yellow plum, ripe pear and a touch of melon. That immense juiciness is confirmed on the palate and joined by a yeasty, leesy texture and fresh lemon notes. It persists into a fruit-driven, almost bouncy finish.

title: Hoopes 2014 Maya's Block Merlot (Howell Mountain)
description: A slight reduction on the nose gives way to a brawny full-bodied expression of leather, black pepper and meat—the fruit elusive at first. Soft and sinewy, it shines on the finish in more discreet elements of cassis and red currant.

title: Jean Loron 2016 Les Grandes Amours  (Saint-Amour)
description: Given the appellation (named after a Roman soldier), there has to be a wine called after great lovers in history. This wine with its good structure will indeed be lovely, or certainly deliciously fruity. Hints of black cherries and acidity suggest it will be ready from late 2018.

title: La Ferme du Mont 2014 Vendage White (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: Notes of pressed apple, nuts and candlewax lend a rustic feel to this full-bodied white blend. While broad and savory, there's an enticing slick in texture as well as zesty hints of lemon and orange peel that linger brightly on the finish.

title: La Pitchoune 2014 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine has a crispness on entry that develops a fleshy texture and medium-bodied weight on the midpalate. Subdued notions of apple, pear and pineapple ply a vibrant layering of stony acidity, with a finish of richer honeycomb.

title: Laurenz V. 2016 Friendly Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: This wine's subdued nose hints at lemon, pear and yeast. The palate puts those three elements in an almost fizzing but concentrated package, where lemon and green pear notes enwrap a yeasty core. Citrusy freshness is the lasting impression.

title: Les Collines 2014 Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: Pristine black plum and cherry notes are edged with fresh herbs and lavender on the nose of this pretty red. Yielding acidity lends a soft, plump feel on the palate but it's sumptous and supple, finishing on fine-grained, persistent tannins.

title: Lion Ranch 2016 Viognier (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Tightly wound aromas of crisp Asian pear, pomelo pith and talcum show on the refreshing nose of this bottling. The palate is extremely grippy, fresh and texturally compelling, with racy flavors of grapefruit pith, Key lime rind and a hint of melon.

title: Manoir du Carra 2016 Terre de Combiaty  (Brouilly)
description: The sector known as Combiaty lies in the southern part of the Brouilly appellation. This wine made from 50-year-old vines is soft and ripe in the classic style of Brouilly. Crisp acidity gives a red-cherry-flavored lift. Drink this wine now.

title: Marrenon 2016 Grand Marrenon White (Luberon)
description: Delicate whiffs of apple, pear and lemon gain concentration and strength on the palate of this richly composed white. It's a languid, supple wine, almost creamy in mouthfeel, but balanced keenly by delicate acidity and a refreshingly salty, smoked-nut finish.

title: Matetic 2013 Corralillo Winemaker's Red (San Antonio)
description: Roasted gamy aromas are spicy and common for cool-climate Syrah, which makes up 60% of this wine along with Malbec and Cabernet Franc. A full and balanced palate is where it needs to be, while gamy spicy black-fruit flavors are mildly herbal and finish with noticeable oak.

title: MontGras 2014 Antu Cabernet Sauvignon-Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)
description: Herbal berry aromas are crisp and toasty. In the mouth, this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Carmenère is jammy and compact. Cherry, blackberry and chocolate flavors are just deep and complex enough to overcome a finish that breaks up quickly.

title: Naggiar 2016 Estate Grown Malbec (Sierra Foothills)
description: This wine smells just like blackberry jam, and tastes wonderfully rich, fruity and full. It has a very deep purple-black color, expressive dark fruit aromas and ripe, almost-sweet, flavors that spread across the palate and linger on the finish.

title: Nine North Wine Company 2015 Seven Sinners The Ransom Old Vines Petite Sirah (California)
description: Very seductive and spicy, this full-bodied wine has enticing aromas of baking spices and toasted oak, with lavish flavors of chocolate and blackberry jam that seem to coat the tongue. The ripe feel seems to soften the thick layer of tannin, so it's approachable now.
designation: Seven Sinners The Ransom Old Vines

title: Paul Cluver 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Elgin)
description: Currently, notes of mocha and chocolate-covered cherry lead the nose of this wine, but there's earthy nuance and restrained red-fruit notes underneath that suggest this wine could benefit from a bit more time for full expression. The structured tannins provide a crushed-velvet texture that retains good grip through the close, with cherry- and plum-skin flavors that carry on through the lingering spicy finish. Try in late 2018 and through 2022.

title: Paul Cluver 2015 Estate Riesling (Elgin)
description: Always one of the top Rieslings from South Africa, this boasts bright notes of apple blossom, white peach, lime peel and lanolin. The palate is nervy and fresh, with superb acidity to partner the ripe stone fruit and verbena tones, all culminating in a tasty, mouthwatering finish. Drink now–2022.

title: Pierre Amadieu 2013 Le Pas de L'Aigle Terroir d'Exception  (Gigondas)
description: Voluptuous and warming, this full-bodied red offers lavish heaps of jammy blackberry and raspberry flavors. It's a bold, intensely juicy wine, nuanced with hints of cocoa, cinnamon and toast. Fine, feathery tannins cushion the finish.
designation: Le Pas de L'Aigle Terroir d'Exception

title: Poggio al Sole 2014 Casasilia Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this has classic varietal aromas of red cherry, leather and a touch of violet. The savory palate offers ripe raspberry, licorice and clove while polished tannins and fresh acidity provide balance and structure. Enjoy through 2025.

title: Poggio Torselli 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: This opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, underbrush and grilled herb while the soft, round palate offers up fleshy black cherry, licorice and a hint of star anise. Supple tannins and fresh acidity provide support. Drink through 2023.

title: Raymond 2014 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)
description: This is a thick, herbal red wine that's tannic in bittersweet tobacco, tomato leaf, black pepper and gunpowder elements, rounded by ripe rich blackberry fruit.

title: Secret des Princes 2013 Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: Ripe yet muted black-cherry and plum notes are cloaked in layers of smoked game, earth and forest floor in this intensely savory red. Medium to full in body, it's sumptuous and rich in mouthfeel yet upright and elegantly composed. Drink now through 2025.

title: Sheldrake Point 2016 Wild Ferment Dry Estate Bottled Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Incredibly pure, pristine aromas of lime zest, crushed stone and white blossoms waft from the glass. The palate is light bodied but boasts firm lime-driven flavors around tart apricot and mineral tones. A pillowy, marshmallow finish lingers on the tongue.

title: Substance 2014 Cs Vineyard Collection Powerline Estate Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This is 100% varietal, coming from the winery's young estate vineyard. The aromas are bright, with notes of dried herb, cherry liqueur, anise, black tea and whole bell pepper, seeming ever so slightly dried out. The flavors are plump but still light on their feet, supported by surprisingly soft tannins for the variety.
designation: Cs Vineyard Collection Powerline Estate Vineyard

title: The Grapes of Roth 2016 Virgin Berry Dry Riesling (Long Island)
description: Red and yellow apple aromas meld with smoke and slate in this Riesling made by Roman Roth. There's impeccable clarity to the palate in its tart peach, lime zest and additional crisp-apple notes. Concentrated, balanced and delightful to sip, flavors of smoke, slate and citrus linger on the finish.

title: Titus 2014 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is both herbaceous and densely thick in chocolate and raspberry liqueur richness, concentrated in flavor and soft in integrated tannin. The oak presents as somewhat charred and toasted, but plays well ultimately with others.
